meanings.sent1: I will prepackage the snacks for the trip tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The company prepackages the products to save time.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she would prepackage all her meals for the week in colorful boxes.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to prepackage memories in neat little boxes.
meanings.sent5: The idea of prepackaging the gifts made the process much easier.

meanings.definition: The act of packaging something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prepackaging of the items helped streamline the workflow.
meanings.sent2: Prepackaging is common in the food industry to ensure freshness.
meanings.sent3: The prepackaging of the party favors made them look like little presents.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the prepackaging of joy, ready to be unwrapped.
meanings.sent5: The prepackaging of the event made it seem more professional.
